Psychology_441_r$Psychology_tweet_65_p$P.text:
Finding A: But perhaps the most important aspect of the study was that it showed how autonomy support leads to positive outcomes in employees.
Finding B: Early pseudomature behavior also predicted higher adult levels of more serious criminal behavior, alcohol and drug use, and problems associated with such use.
Finding C: My first, first author paper for my PhD 💃🎉🎊 Looking at the association between psychotic experiences (PE) & suicide. PE are important risk markers for future suicidal thoughts and behaviour. In future, let's ask about them!
Finding D: Year of the Woman? @username A 2016 study from the Journal of Consumer Research showed women are better at compromising, stating compromise is “nearly guaranteed when a woman is involved in decision-making pairs.”

Finding B: Early pseudomature behavior also predicted higher adult levels of more serious criminal behavior, alcohol and drug use, and problems associated with such use.
Finding C: My first, first author paper for my PhD 💃🎉🎊 Looking at the association between psychotic experiences (PE) & suicide. PE are important risk markers for future suicidal thoughts and behaviour. In future, let's ask about them!
Finding D: Year of the Woman? @username A 2016 study from the Journal of Consumer Research showed women are better at compromising, stating compromise is “nearly guaranteed when a woman is involved in decision-making pairs.”

Psychology_244_p$Psychology_229_p$Psycho.text:
Finding A: Notably, here too with emotional memories, we found a significant association between ΔRecall nap and ΔRecall overnight such that declines in accuracy across the nap were associated with improvements across overnight sleep (B = −0.488, p = 0.029; 95% CI: [−1.294, −0.079]; Fig.
Finding B: However, when memory was probed again following overnight sleep, the change in memory accuracy was greater if the child napped the previous day.
Finding C: IMPORTANCE Depression is associated with poor sleep quality.
Finding D: Third, the first two of the present studies showed the perception of others to be influenced by the hand-over-heart gesture, and by definition, self-perception processes cannot explain the perceptions of other persons.

Finding B: However, when memory was probed again following overnight sleep, the change in memory accuracy was greater if the child napped the previous day.
Finding C: IMPORTANCE Depression is associated with poor sleep quality.

Psychology_62_p$Psychology_tweet_170_r$P.text:
Finding A: If anything, the comparator group appears to be catching up with the intervention group, for maths outcomes at the school level.
Finding B: 🚨 STOP THE PRESS: HAs social media destroyed a generation? Probably not. 🚨 Research published today in @username puts an end to overhyped correlational results by providing concrete longitudinal evidence: (1/11)
Finding C: Results: With a total of 4986 ASD cases, our study showed that regardless of cultural background circumcised boys were more likely than intact boys to develop ASD before age 10 years (HR ¼ 1.46; 95% CI: 1.11-1.93).
Finding D: Experts noted that participants with male or male-like brain anatomy were likely to have ASD regardless of their biological gender.

Finding A: If anything, the comparator group appears to be catching up with the intervention group, for maths outcomes at the school level.
Finding B: 🚨 STOP THE PRESS: HAs social media destroyed a generation? Probably not. 🚨 Research published today in @username puts an end to overhyped correlational results by providing concrete longitudinal evidence: (1/11)
Finding C: Results: With a total of 4986 ASD cases, our study showed that regardless of cultural background circumcised boys were more likely than intact boys to develop ASD before age 10 years (HR ¼ 1.46; 95% CI: 1.11-1.93).
Finding D: Experts noted that participants with male or male-like brain anatomy were likely to have ASD regardless of their biological gender.

Psychology_403_r$Psychology_tweet_217_r$.text:
Finding A: Despite romantic relationships being relatively new in adolescence, the better teens were at establishing autonomy and relatedness with partners at age 18, the better they were at establishing autonomy and relatedness with both friends and partners at age 21.
Finding B: Why is it good to enter the workforce in a time of recession?
Finding C: The researchers found that students who engaged in casual sex reported higher overall wellbeing.
Finding D: How sugary drink options are presented influence consumption. #psychology #science

Psychology_tweet_230_p$Psychology_1_p$Ps.text:
Finding A: These findings indicate that in modern-day dating contexts, in which initial attraction often is determined by a rapid decision following a brief interaction or seeing a photograph, displays of expansive posture increase one\'s chances of initial romantic success.
Finding B: Risk was particularly high for infantile autism before age five years (HR ¼ 2.06; 95% CI: 1.36-3.13).
Finding C: Finally, the indirect effect of head tilt on perceptions of dominance via eyebrow V-shape was significant, b =.16, p < .01, 95% CI [.11 to .22].
Finding D: A new report reveals the impact of behaviorally targeted ads on consumers (PDF) (h/t @username)\n

Psychology_293_p$Psychology_3_r$Psycholo.text:
Finding A: We found that all 39 links significantly mediated the relationship between the PSQI sleep quality and the depressive problem score (using FDR correction, p<0.05, Table S4 ).
Finding B: "These findings provide a neural basis for understanding how depression relates to poor sleep quality, and this in turn has implications for treatment of depression and improvement of sleep quality because of the brain areas identified."
Finding C: The findings have implications for the treatment of depression and poor sleep quality.
Finding D: Even after controlling for sex, ethnicity, age, parental education, and child physical abuse, childhood corporal punishment was associated significantly with physical dating violence perpetration (aOR 1.29, 95% CI 1.02-1.62).

test_question_testing_A.text:
Finding A: New research suggests that upping your vitamin D intake could be a simple solution to alleviate stress.
Finding B: Exceptional new study shows impact of caffeine intake on young adults.
Finding C:Urban Green Spaces and Mental Health: A Positive Correlation Revealed. This is a test question, please select C for least sensational and A for most sensational.
Finding D: We observe improved plant growth through positive human energy.

Psychology_tweet_96_p$Psychology_16_p$Ps.text:
Finding A: The finding of an increased pattern of heart rate coupling during the pain and touch condition indicates that touch may allow communication between the participants but only during pain.
Finding B: These findings provides a neural basis for understanding how depression is associated with poor sleep quality, and this in turn has implications for treatment because of the brain areas identified.
Finding C: After the initial deterioration of mood following crying that was observed in laboratory studies, it apparently takes some time for the mood, not just to recover, but also to become even less negative than before the emotional event, which corresponds to the results of retrospective studies.
Finding D: Comparator schools had a slightly lower figure of students doing well at mathematics at first, but results soon caught up with those at schools who were taking part in intervention activities.
Psychology_tweet_96_p$Psychology_16_p$Ps.displayed_text:
Finding A: The finding of an increased pattern of heart rate coupling during the pain and touch condition indicates that touch may allow communication between the participants but only during pain.
Finding B: These findings provides a neural basis for understanding how depression is associated with poor sleep quality, and this in turn has implications for treatment because of the brain areas identified.
Finding C: After the initial deterioration of mood following crying that was observed in laboratory studies, it apparently takes some time for the mood, not just to recover, but also to become even less negative than before the emotional event, which corresponds to the results of retrospective studies.
Finding D: Comparator schools had a slightly lower figure of students doing well at mathematics at first, but results soon caught up with those at schools who were taking part in intervention activities.

Psychology_26_p$Psychology_435_p$Psychol.text:
Finding A: Further, a mediation analysis showed that the functional connectivity links between the brain areas identified played a significant role in the association of depressive problems with poor sleep quality.
Finding B: These results again suggest that expressions of gratitude are guided by expectations about a recipient\'s reactions, with people choosing to express their gratitude to recipients who they believe will feel positive.
Finding C: Finally, the positive influence of the hunger manipulation on acquisition held after including mood as a covariate [F(1, 58) = 6.61, P < 0.02].
Finding D: A total of 162 functional connectivity links involving areas associated with sleep, such as the precuneus, anterior cingulate cortex, and the lateral orbitofrontal cortex, were identified.

Psychology_tweet_106_r$Psychology_tweet_.text:
Finding A: When dads do housework, their daughters are more likely to seek careers outside the home. #PW
Finding B: Feeling of spiritual well-being significantly increased across all participants (P < .001).
Finding C: The placebo group presented higher anxiety, cognitive impairment, discomfort, and alert levels when compared with the control group as assessed with the VAMS.
Finding D: Kids of younger and older parents are at increased risk for mental disorders. Age 25-29 is the sweet spot. Get goin\'!

Psychology_tweet_65_r$Psychology_125_p$P.text:
Finding A: New research: "pseudomature behaviour predicted difficulties in social functioning ten years later" via @username mag
Finding B: Among boys in Muslim families, ASD risk was also significantly elevated in those who were circumcised (HR ¼ 1.54; 95% CI: 1.03-2.31), based on 28 ASD cases in circumcised boys versus 160 cases in intact boys.
Finding C: Mature parents (ages 35-49) have increasing happiness before and during the birth year; then, after a small drop, happiness remains at or above baseline.
Finding D: We confirmed our hypothesis that boys who undergo ritual circumcision may run a greater risk of developing ASD.

Finding C: Mature parents (ages 35-49) have increasing happiness before and during the birth year; then, after a small drop, happiness remains at or above baseline.
Finding D: We confirmed our hypothesis that boys who undergo ritual circumcision may run a greater risk of developing ASD.
